title: for the love of god, remove lees w/flash ult combo
body:
just nerf him into the ground like eve, urgot and olaf until you rework him.

i want a rioter to come right here and explain to me how to counterplay his flash ult combo with the fucking mini stun attached and why this shit by all your design standarts is still in the game. any monkey can pull of reliable ganks with that champion after a couple of games with him. it has absolutely nothing to do with skill.

how are you supposed to deal with his ability to always get into range for a point blank q/ult if youre not hypermobile yourself?

either let us flash during his ult animation aswell, so we can counter this bullshit somehow, or remove the entire champion from the playing field.

the cooldown nerf on the ability wont add counterplay to his combos.

you absolutely dumpstered {{champion:98}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:79}} for their flash engages/interactions. i dont understand why lee gets special treatment.

The problem is not everyone wants League to be balanced around pro play. DotA, under IceFrog, has had the direction of being balanced around high-level play and the potential of heroes rather than necessarily what everyone else can do essentially from the beginning of IceFrog's tenure. He wasn't going to meander around trying to balance for both amateurs and pros because that causes inherent problems (how long has it been since you've seen Heimerdinger or Yi in pro play?). 

League has 3 options, and that is continue on their path of trying to please both pros and amateur, which keeps these inherent issues; throw their pro scene to the wolves and balance for amateur play; or force amateur players to grow into the pro-level balance. Everyone has their own opinions of which it should be and there is no real "right" answer. IceFrog's system works for DotA, but there's no guarantee that pro balancing will work for League.
This. It might also be one of the reasons why League's player base is what, 10 times larger than DotA's?

Essentially, yeah. You're not going to steal DotA's players away from DotA by trying to balance like DotA, because they have DotA for that, so I personally think League should probably aim more for the retention of amateur players, but again, there's no "right" answer. 

My mind used to be that League should balance toward high-level play, but it's kind of shifted. If people want a game balanced toward high-level play, they have that option. League doesn't need to be the kind of game that stretches itself thin to try to appease everyone, because as endearing as it is to see it care enough to try, it's ultimately harming itself in the long run to do so, I feel, and you're not likely to balance high level play better than DotA2 in this regard since it has far more it can reliably do to maintain that level of balance.
Cause DotA balances around pro play

the problem is that is not the case

let's say lee sin is a beefy martial artist and a point and click or targetless champion is a trained marksman with a handgun

if "lee" can get close, he can utterly annihilate the marksman, but, this should not be the case in most situations

in most cases, a player is not going to be near the bushes where lee could justifiably crush them unless he hides in the very bottom bushes or gets to be behind them(which presents the problems of junglers dictating how a game is played where a good jungler wins and a bad jungler loses the game for you )

what makes this a problem, however is that lee's combo collectively has a range of 1525 in optimal conditions but if we cut that it still comes to roughly 1225 400(ward) 450(flash) 375(lee's ult)

both of those ranges are tied to flash's cooldown but put it this way, twisted fate and nidalee are the only champions I can think of with 1500 range in standard abilities and neither of which has crowd control AND displacement attached to it

twisted fate can have his gold card but its able to be negated  and leaves him excessively vulnerable

nidalee can do large poke damage but unless she is in close quarters will not execute a champion with her abilities except for the rare case of a Q getting enough distance for a low HP champ
if any player is very good at performing a specific combo you can expect them to execute it perfectly. If that results in you dying, git gud

The difference between those 3 you listed and Lee Sin is that they don't have to be in melee range to use them.  In fact, they use them to get into melee range to land their hard CC while Lee already has to be in melee range to do his flash combo.  Lee would be kinda useless without his ward hop/flash ult combo because of how unreliable his ult would be especially without the root.

The flash combo isn't too hard to pull off with enough practice, but that has a high cooldown.  The ward hop, on the other hand, takes quite a bit of skill to use.  Ward hopping immediately after the Q lands at just the right angle (having to predict whether the enemy will try to run to) to ult the carry into your team is pretty hard to do especially late game.  That's not taking into account that a lot of carries he's going after can use their mobility spells to avoid that sweet spot angle he's going for.  If you look at a lot of the MSI games you can see this for yourself.

He's an early game champ, but he needs some way to stay relevant during the late game which is why he has his ward hop + ult combo.  Otherwise, he would be pretty useless.  You would have to completely rework him to take that away from him and Lee's kit really doesn't need that.  I'm not a Lee Sin fanboy or anything, but suggesting to take away his flash/ward hop + ult combo is just silly.

the problem is that lee sin doesnt have counterplay. its basically a question of, does his player fuck up or does he pull off his combo clean on a gank? you, as his opponent dont have a say in the matter if you can avoid t or not. if he doesnt make a mistake then there is nothing you could do to prevent getting shit on. even if you played the situation perfectly yourself.

lee sin when optimal played doesnt give his opponent room for counterplay.

its the same issue with other flash interactions and why those champions got nerfed into the ground. they turned skillshots into direct target abilities by flashing onto the hitbox of their opponent mid dash.

gragas mid body slam flash, reksais flash into a knockup, or shens mid dash flashing into a taunt.

with lee sin its a similar problem. he easily manages to get into point blank range for his q, which makes the ability being a skillshot mute, and is able to flash into position for an ult and to adjust the direction of the ult. the mini cc attached to the kick doesnt even allow his opponent to react with a flash himself.

basically his ward hop into flash + ult + q, q cant be avoided on almost every single champion. there are only very few exceptions.

its these unavoidable flash combos that make lee insanely reliable on his ganks.

Fiora's skillshot is harder to avoid, and Riven has basically nothing that counts as avoidable, since her ult is stupid-wide. A perfectly played Riven leaves you no chance to win. But even a perfectly played {{champion:6}} is impossible to beat, that's the definition of perfectly played.

Gragas's is a heavy stun, with an AoE knockback. Lee can only kick one person. That leaves Gragas free to walk away, and Lee very susceptible to a Leona combo.

Rek'sai is a champion with a very easy escape, and, I do believe, has another AoE. I can't be certain, though, because I haven't seen Rek very much.

Shen's taunt also comes with invulernability, and can't be body-blocked…seeing a theme, here? Lee's kit leaves him very vulnerable. Shen, Gragas, and Rek'sai all have some saving mechanism in their kit, typically in the form of AoE CC.
